data.title: A full breakdown of every American Idol winner — and what they're up to now
data.meta_description: Every American Idol winner has taken a different path with their careers.
data.text:
American Idol: Abi Carter wins Season 22

American Idol has produced a slew of successful winners throughout its over two-decade run.

Highlights include Kelly Clarkson, Carrie Underwood, Jordin Sparks, and more.

While some of these talented singers have achieved mega stardom, others are focused on growing their music careers.

American Idol fans call for J.Lo, Richard Simmons and more to replace Katy Perry

Katy Perry's American Idol run — from 'tension' backstage to 'inflated salary'

But what are all the American Idol winners doing now?

Here is a full list of all 22 winners, and what they’ve been up to since their victories.

Kelly Clarkson (Season 1)

Arguably American Idol’s most successful winner, Clarkson has sold over 45 million singles and won three Grammy awards.

Her first single, “A Moment Like This,” which she sang on the American Idol season 1 finale, reached the number one position on the Billboard US Hot 100 charts. Other hits include “Since U Been Gone,” “Breakaway,” “Because of You,” “Behind These Hazel Eyes,” and more.

Currently, she hosts her talk show The Kelly Clarkson Show on NBC, and has previously served as a coach on The Voice. She has two children, River and Remington, who she shares with her now ex-husband, Brandon Blackstock.

Ruben Studdard (Season 2)

After being crowned the second American Idol winner in 2003, Studdard was nominated for a Grammy award for Best Male R&B Vocal Performance. His debut album, Soulful, reached the number one position on the Billboard 200. He has since released seven other albums.

In 2008, he starred as the lead character in the national tour of the musical Ain’t Misbehavin’.

Fantasia Barrino (Season 3)

Fantasia’s version of the jazz standard “Summertime” is commonly regarded as one of the best performances in American Idol history.

Afterwards, her debut single “I Believe” reached the number one position on the Billboard Hot 100 charts, and she also went on to win a Grammy for Best Female R&B Vocal Performance for her song “Bittersweet.”

Notably, she also starred as the lead character Celie in the Broadway production of The Color Purple, and reprised her role in the 2023 film version.

Carrie Underwood (Season 4)

The country singer has taken home a whopping eight Grammy awards and sold over 85 million albums. Her major hits include “Before He Cheats,” “Jesus, Take the Wheel,” and “Cowboy Cassanova.”

On May 20, nearly two decades after taking home the season 4 winning title, Underwood reflected on her initial audition with a throwback photo.

“contestant number #14887 received her golden ticket to Hollywood! I can’t believe it has been almost 20 years since auditioning for @AmericanIdol!,” she wrote on the Instagram caption.

Taylor Hicks (Season 5)

Two years after his win, Hicks played Teen Angel in the Broadway revival of Grease. He then went on to have his own Las Vegas Residency in 2012.

“It’s a true full-circle moment for me,” Hicks told The Hollywood Reporter of his Sin City venture, as his original American Idol audition took place in Las Vegas.

Hicks has released two official albums, Taylor Hicks (2006) and The Distance (2009).

Jordin Sparks (Season 6)

When she took home her victory at the age of 17, Sparks became the youngest American Idol winner in the show’s history. Her hits include “Tattoo,” “No Air,” and “Battlefield.”

She has released four studio albums, and is currently working on her fifth. “I want to be able to record the music that I want to record because I want to record it, not because it has to meet certain criteria,” she told People. “I want to make it for me, and I want to believe in it, and I want to love it.”

Sparks has also starred in Broadway productions of In The Heights and Waitress.

David Cook (Season 7)

Cook’s debut single “Time of My Life,” reached the number three position on the US Billboard Hot 100 charts. He has since released four studio albums.

As for his personal life, his brother died of brain cancer in 2009, and Cook has since become an advocate for the disease. He also tied the knot with his girlfriend Racheal Stump in 2015.

In 2018, Cook starred in the Broadway production of Kinky Boots.

Kris Allen (Season 8)

After getting more votes than Adam Lambert, something that was considered controversial at the time, Allen’s single “No Boundaries” went on to reach the number 11 position on the Billboard US Hot 100 charts. He has since released six studio albums total.

Currently, he is married to his high school sweetheart Katy O'Connell, and the two have two sons and a daughter.

Lee Dewyze (Season 9)

Dewyze has released eight albums since his win, with his most recent, Ghost Stories, coming out in 2021. He has been married to actress Jonna Walsh since 2012.

In 2012, Dewyze opened up to The Daily Beast about his career after winning American Idol.

“After I won, I definitely would have done some different things. To be honest, I probably wouldn’t have released some of the singles. I don't want to represent myself in a way that isn't me. I wanted to be a part of the writing process. That made it more stressful; having to write an album while you are on tour is overwhelming,” he said.

Don't Miss...

Katy Perry doesn't think Jelly Roll is good replacement for her on American Idol [INSIGHT]

American Idol fans ‘concerned’ about Wynonna Judd after finale performance [REACTION]

American Idol fans floored as Katy Perry rocks giant dress with special meaning [WATCH]

Phillip Phillips (Season 11)

Phillips is best known for his single “Home,” which reached the number six position on the US Billboard Hot 100 charts. He has also performed with John Mayer, Gavin DeGraw, the Goo Goo Dolls, and Bruce Springsteen.

He has released four studio albums total, and he and his wife, Hannah, welcomed a son in 2019.

Candice Glover (Season 12)

Glover released her debut album, Music Speaks, in 2014.

This May, she performed with season 2 winner Ruben Studdard in Las Vegas, Arizona, and Mississippi.

“So much fun getting to perform with @realrubenstuddard on tour this weekend

Nick Fradiani (Season 14)

Fradiani released his debut album, Hurricane, in 2016. He also starred in the national tour of A Bronx Tale in 2017. Currently, he is playing the role of Neil Diamond in the Broadway musical A Beautiful Noise, based on Diamond's life.

Trent Harmon (Season 15)

Harmon’s winning single “Falling” was co-written by then judge Keith Urban. His debut album, You Got ‘Em All, was released in 2018.

In October 2023, Harmon welcomed a baby girl named Dolly Jean.

Maddie Poppe (Season 16)

Poppe’s first studio album Whirlwind was released in 2019, and she toured with Ingrid Michaelson that year.

She released her most recent single, Good Enough to Let You Go, in May 2023.

Poppe also competed on The Voice before her American Idol days.

Laine Hardy (Season 17)

Hardy’s debut album Here’s to Anyone was released in 2021. His previous singles include “Ground I Grew Up On” and “Flame.”

In 2022, Hardy was arrested for allegedly planning a recording device in his ex-girlfriend’s dorm room.

Just Sam (Season 18)

Just Sam won American Idol’s virtual season in May 2020. After their victory, they signed with Hollywood Records, although the deal was short-lived.

“I never saw anyone on a show like that who won, like, go back to their old life,” they told The Washington Post.

In 2023, Just Sam revealed via Instagram that they were still busking in New York City to make ends meet.

However, they have high hopes for their future.

"Everybody's waiting to see that big blowup moment again like 'Idol.' I think it's going to be something greater than 'Idol' — no shade, I love them," Just Sam said. "But I think that wasn't the end."

Chayce Beckham (Season 19)

Beckham performed his original song “23” on American Idol, and it was the first American Idol winning single to be written by a contestant.

After his win, Beckham said that he originally faced challenges juggling his finances. “Getting management right away coming off Idol, that was one of the best things that I did,” he told Forbes in 2022.

Beckham has since performed with Luke Bryan and Luke Combs.

Noah Thompson (Season 20)

Thompson’s EP, God Only Knows Where, was released in June 2023. Currently he resides in Nashville, Tennessee, and has a three year old son named Walker.

Iam Tongi (Season 21)

Tongi is the first Pacific Islander to win the competition. He currently has three singles, “I”ll Be Seeing You,” “The Winner Takes it All,” and “Why Kiki?” He currently has over 900k Instagram followers.

Abi Carter (Season 22)

After taking home the winning title in May 2024, Carter told People in a recent interview about her future plans for her career.

"I want to start releasing songs ASAP. I've been writing for so long now and I can't wait to put something out in the world that I so fully believe in," she told the outlet.

"Not that the other ones that I've put out have not because they do, but I think it'll be just a little bit different and I'm really excited for it," she added.
